BR_text.BRsummary: Zoom on high resolution images freezes
BR_text.BRdescription:
When zooming annotated image that has > 5000x5000 pixels resolution, the canvas stops working.
 Browser:
 Firefox 65.0.1 (64-bit), Ubuntu 18.04
 COCO annotator at <denchmark-link:https://annotator.justinbrooks.ca/>https://annotator.justinbrooks.ca/</denchmark-link>
 
 How to replicate
 Create a catagory, generate sample dataset ('high resolution' keyword),
 pick a brush tool, make some path, zoom in until canvas stops responding

comments_0.comment_text:
This is a limitation of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/paperjs/paper.js>paperjs</denchmark-link>
  (<denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25503708/view-zoom-is-rendering-slow-for-large-canvas-size-in-paper-js>stackoverflow</denchmark-link>
 ). As mentioned in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jsbroks/coco-annotator/issues/150>#150</denchmark-link>
  try to limit the amount of keypoints.
 Let me know if any of the follow could help with your us case:
 
 All images will be resize to be no larger then 2000 and all annotations will then be scaled to match the original on save
 A toggle option for CSS zooming. This would fix the performance issue but when you zoom it the quality would degrade and no component properties will be able to scale with zoom.
 
 I have created an issue on there repo <denchmark-link:https://github.com/paperjs/paper.js/issues/1644>paperjs/paper.js#1644</denchmark-link>

comments_2.comment_text: Tried on latest docker image, the zoom->freeze issue is solved, but annotations are not transparent, is this intentional?

comments_3.comment_text:
They should be still transparent, I did increase the transparency to 70% instead of 50%, since I remove the outline around the annotations. I'm going to add in a sliding-bar soon to select the transparency.
 Can you confirm that the annotations are somewhat transparent?

comments_4.comment_text:
So it is a bug, when you load annotations they are transparent but once you apply an operation to them they become non-transparent. I'm closing this issue, since its not related.
 Please open a new one

comments_5.comment_text: Thanks for fast response, I confirm your claim that annotations are loaded transparent but modifications causes lost of transparency. New issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jsbroks/coco-annotator/issues/161>#161</denchmark-link>
